title: Dani Alves Goes In On Real Madrid Defender Sergio Ramos
text:
Dani Alves Goes In On Real Madrid Defender Sergio Ramos Tue Feb 21 2017 16:56:00 GMT+0000 (GMT) Tue Feb 21 2017 16:56:00 GMT+0000 (GMT) Josh Lawless Josh Lawless in football 
Juventus Dani Alves has been giving it out recently. 
The Brazilian ripped into the hierarchy at his old club Barcelona and their treatment of him. 
The defender, currently recovering from a broken leg he suffered back in November, opened up on his situation at Barcelona and did not speak about the club's directors in a positive light. 
As quoted by ABC , he said: 
"I like to feel wanted, and if someone doesn't want me then I'm leaving. 
"Leaving Barcelona on a free was a classy punch. During my last three seasons I kept hearing 'Dani Alves is leaving', but the directors never said anything."They were very false and ungrateful, they didn't respect me. They only offered me a renewal when they got the FIFA sanctions. 
"That's why I played them at their own game and signed a renewal with a release clause. Those who run Barcelona today have no idea how to treat their players." 
During his recent interview, Alves was also asked about Real Madrid skipper Sergio Ramos. The Spaniard was not only met with boos and jeers when he returned to the Ramรณn Sรกnchez Pizjuรกn Stadium last month to play against boyhood club Sevilla in the 3-3 Copa Del Rey draw, he also claimed to be on the end of insults and chants about his mother and gestured to the fans when he scored in the 83rd minute. 
And though Alves says he did not agree with the level of abuse his former teammate was on the receiving end of in the game, he says with the way his career with the Andalusian club ended, it's no surprise. 
He said: 
"I think it's totally wrong that Ramos is subjected to insults, but at the same time he may not be in a position to make these demands from the fans regarding respect. 
"Ramos to be frank didn't achieve that much at Sevilla to not celebrate goals or to ask for forgiveness when scoring. I was there for six years and won plenty of titles. 
"Just a few days before moving to Real Madrid, Ramos declared eternal love for Sevilla and that is the root problem of the anger that the fans hold towards Ramos. He's still hostage to those words." 
What do you make of Alves' latest comments? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.
